intro: Galium ossirwaense var. ossirwaense, commonly known as the Ossirwa grassvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are often branched and covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the late spring to early summer. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
